tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE backstage_schedules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_date DATE,
    event_time TIME,
    hair_stylist_name VARCHAR(50),
    makeup_artist_name VARCHAR(50),
    dresser_name VARCHAR(50),
    task_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Stylists (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    specialty VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE Logistics (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    event_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE stylists (
    stylist_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    expertise VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE makeup_artists (
    artist_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    specialty VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE dressers (
    dresser_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    experience_years INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE schedules (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    stylist_id INT,
    artist_id INT,
    dresser_id INT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    end_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (stylist_id) REFERENCES stylists(stylist_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (artist_id) REFERENCES makeup_artists(artist_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (dresser_id) REFERENCES dressers(dresser_id)
)

CREATE TABLE BackstageSchedules (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    show_id INT REFERENCES FashionShows(show_id),
    stylist_id INT REFERENCES HairStylists(stylist_id),
    artist_id INT REFERENCES MakeupArtists(artist_id),
    dresser_id INT REFERENCES Dressers(dresser_id),
    start_time TIME NOT NULL,
    end_time TIME NOT NULL
);
